title: Apple is the most valuable brand to consumers for the 7th year in a row, report says
text:
CLOSE A leaked investor note outlines its possible Spring release. Buzz60’s Tony Spitz has the details. Buzz60

People often complain that new iPhones are too expensive, or that Airpods are easy to lose or that Apple Stores are too crowded.

Still, the tech giant reigns supreme as the world's most valuable brand for the seventh year in a row.

The corporate consulting agency Interbrand just released its annual report on brand value and the MacBook maker outranked Google, Amazon and Microsoft once again. Interbrand says it takes into consideration brand relevance, financial results and the company's impact on culture and services.

You're probably not using Spotify right. Here's how to get the most out of your music

AI bias: How tech determines if you land job, get a loan or end up in jail

Early Thursday, Interbrand tweeted, "With a slow but sure shift from products into services, @Apple continues to build a formidable ecosystem. The tech giant also rose its brand value by 9 percent."

Seventh consecutive year as #1 brand! With a slow but sure shift from products into services, @Apple continues to build a formidable ecosystem. The tech giant also rose its brand value by 9 percent to 234,240$m. https://t.co/djqYvzq75K#BGB2019#IconicMovespic.twitter.com/RyCn6nyzBZ — Interbrand (@Interbrand) October 17, 2019

Interbrand estimates that Apple's brand strength is worth $234 billion, and the tech giant's impact has grown steadily since 2002, according to the report.

Google ranked second with an overall branded value of almost $168 billion and the e-commerce behemoth Amazon came in third with $125 billion. The search giant's brand strength grew 8% over last year, while Amazon surged 24% with its highly successful AI-enabled home assistants.

Facebook, which owns Instagram and WhatsApp, fell out of the top 10 this year, dropping from 9th place to 14th after being plagued by high profile privacy scandals. The social networking company's brand strength fell 12% to $40 billion, according to the report.

Other notable companies on the list include Microsoft (fourth), Disney (10th) and Gillette (37th).

Microsoft's branded value jumped 17% to almost $109 billion over last year. The company recently announced an upcoming smartphone and dual-screen Windows PC. Disney recently acquired 21st Century Fox and plans to launch a streaming division soon.

Gillette took a major hit with an 18% drop in brand value this year. The shaving products company sank to 37th place from 28th.

Follow Dalvin Brown on Twitter: @Dalvin_Brown.

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2019/10/17/apple-google-and-amazon-most-relevant-brands-globally-report/4006432002/
description: The brand consulting agency Interbrand just released its annual report on brand value and Apple outranked Google, Amazon and Microsoft once again.
